trans-unit.source: Represents a common dialog that allows the user to specify a filename to save a file as.
SaveFileDialog cannot be used by an application that is executing under partial trust.
The following figure shows a SaveFileDialog for [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winvista](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-winvista-md.md)].

![Save As dialog box](~/add/media/dialogboxesoverviewfigure3.png "Save As dialog box") Starting in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winvista](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-winvista-md.md)], open and save file dialog boxes have a **Favorite Links** panel on the left side of the dialog box that allows the user to quickly navigate to a different location.
These links are called custom places.
Use the <xref:Microsoft.Win32.FileDialog.CustomPlaces%2A> property to set this list of links.
## XAML Text Usage You cannot declare this managed class in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)].
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="Microsoft.Win32.SaveFileDialog"></xref> class.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether <xref href="Microsoft.Win32.SaveFileDialog"></xref> prompts the user for permission to create a file if the user specifies a file that does not exist.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if dialog should prompt prior to saving to a filename that did not previously exist; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Creates a read-write file stream for the filename selected by the user using <xref href="Microsoft.Win32.SaveFileDialog"></xref>.
The file stream that is returned is opened with read-write access (<xref:System.IO.FileMode> and <xref:System.IO.FileAccess>).
A new <xref:System.IO.Stream> that contains the selected file.
No files were selected in the dialog.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether <xref href="Microsoft.Win32.SaveFileDialog"></xref> displays a warning if the user specifies the name of a file that already exists.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if dialog should prompt prior to saving over a filename that previously existed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Resets all <xref href="Microsoft.Win32.SaveFileDialog"></xref> properties to their default values.
